description: For moments when the user desires encouragement, positivity, and trust in Allah’s mercy and future provisions.

primary.text_en: Say, 'O My servants who have transgressed against themselves [by sinning], do not despair of the mercy of Allah. Indeed, Allah forgives all sins.'
primary.text_ar: قُلْ يَٰعِبَادِيَ ٱلَّذِينَ أَسْرَفُوا۟ عَلَىٰٓ أَنفُسِهِمْ لَا تَقْنَطُوا۟ مِن رَّحْمَةِ ٱللَّهِ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَغْفِرُ ٱلذُّنُوبَ جَمِيعًا
primary.explanation: No matter what you've done, hope in Allah’s mercy must remain.

primary.text_en: Indeed, with hardship comes ease. Indeed, with hardship comes ease.
primary.text_ar: فَإِنَّ مَعَ ٱلْعُسْرِ يُسْرًا إِنَّ مَعَ ٱلْعُسْرِ يُسْرًا
primary.explanation: Allah promises ease, not once — but twice.

primary.text_en: And whoever fears Allah — He will make a way out for him and provide for him from where he does not expect.
primary.text_ar: وَمَن يَتَّقِ ٱللَّهَ يَجْعَل لَّهُۥ مَخْرَجٗا وَيَرْزُقْهُ مِنْ حَيْثُ لَا يَحْتَسِبُ
primary.explanation: Hope comes from knowing Allah can open doors you never saw.

primary.text_en: If you rely upon Allah with due reliance, He would provide for you as He provides for the birds: they go out hungry in the morning and return full in the evening.
primary.explanation: Hope grows with trust in Allah’s plan.

primary.text_en: Amazing is the affair of the believer! There is good for him in every matter.
primary.explanation: Believers always have something to hope for.

primary.text_en: Make things easy and do not make things difficult. Give glad tidings and do not repel people.
primary.explanation: Our religion is full of hope and mercy.

duas.text_en: O Allah, I ask You for mercy from You that guides my heart, gathers my affairs, and uplifts my hopelessness.
duas.text_ar: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ رَحْمَةً مِّنْ عِندِكَ تَهْدِي بِهَا قَلْبِي وَتَجْمَعُ بِهَا أَمْرِي وَتَلُمُّ بِهَا شَعَثِي
duas.explanation: A prayer to re-center the heart with mercy.

duas.text_en: O Turner of the hearts, keep my heart firm upon Your religion.
duas.text_ar: يَا مُقَلِّبَ الْقُلُوبِ ثَبِّتْ قَلْبِي عَلَى دِينِكَ

reflection: Hope is not blind optimism — it is light rooted in divine truth. When clouds of worry hover, the believer remembers Allah’s names: Ar-Rahman, Al-Fattah, Al-Hakeem. Every delay, every pain, and every silence carries meaning. Stay hopeful — because He never breaks His promises.
